tool_description: This API provides an interface to the TradingView, enabling users to interact with TradingView's financial data. It offers two main endpoints: /search_symbol and /get_hist. The /search_symbol endpoint allows users to search for financial symbols on a specified exchange. The /get_hist endpoint retrieves historical data for a given symbol, including open, high, low, close, and volume values over a specified interval. This API is designed to be user-friendly and efficient, providing quick access...
name: ekoView
title: ekoView

api_list.name: getallstocks
api_list.description: The /get_all_stocks endpoint retrieves all stocks available in an specific exchange.

api_list.name: getsells
api_list.description: The /get_sells endpoint retrieves all stocks available in an specific exchange with SELL signal as recommendation.

api_list.name: getstrongsells
api_list.description: The /get_strong_sells endpoint retrieves all stocks available in an specific exchange with STORNG_SELL signal as recommendation.

api_list.name: getbuys
api_list.description: The /get_strong_buys endpoint retrieves all stocks available in an specific exchange with BUY signal as recommendation.

api_list.name: getstrongbuys
api_list.description: The /get_strong_buys endpoint retrieves all stocks available in an specific exchange with STORNG_BUY signal as recommendation.

api_list.name: analysis
api_list.description: This endpoint returns the results of a technical analysis performed by TradingView for a specified symbol. Please note that the 'screener' parameter can be set to values such as 'america', 'indonesia', 'forex', or 'crypto' to filter the analysis based on the specific market.

api_list.name: searchsymbol
api_list.description: The /search_symbol endpoint allows users to search for financial symbols on a specified exchange.

api_list.name: gethist
api_list.description: The /get_hist endpoint retrieves historical data for a given symbol, including open, high, low, close, and volume values over a specified interval.
